## 사건 정보

**사건명**: State v. Jack H. Ammons and Marion (Alias Arthur) Ammons.
**판결일**: 1933-06-14
**법원**: Supreme Court of North Carolina
**관할**: North Carolina, NC

**판사**: ClaRkson

## 변호인



Attorney-General Brum-mitt and Assistant Attorney-General Seaiuell for the State.
, 
Edward H. McMahan for defendants.


## 인용

- 169 S.E. 631
- 204 N.C. 753

## 판결문 요약

The defendants, Jack H. Ammons, Marion (alias Arthur) Ammons, Walter Yarborough, Sam Todd and A. D. Cordell, were indicted in a bill of indictment containing three counts: (1) charging the defendants with castrating the prosecuting witness Johnnie Hart; (2) secret assault; (3) felonious assault. A mistrial was ordered by the court as to the defendants Yarborough, Todd and Cordell, and the solicitor as to them took a nol.pros. with leave. The defendants Ammons were convicted under the first count in the bill of indictment and sentenced by the court below.
Johnnie Hart, a witness for the State, testified to the effect that he was 26 years old, lived in Biltmore, N.C. and was married. On Monday, 7 November, 1932, 20 minutes to 12 o'clock he was castrated. "I left and went toward my home, walked up the paved road to the end of a warehouse on a side track. I then went to the woods to get me a load of fire wood. . . . In two or three minutes I was grabbed. Jack Ammons was on the side of thepath along which I was walking in the woods, he grabbed me by the leftwrist. Somebody hit me on the head. I don't know what Jack Ammons had in his hands, it looked like a knife. As he grabbed me I was hit in the head. I could not see who hit me. I didn't turn around. They threw something over my head that I couldn't see through. I fell to the ground, and after I fell somebody tore my shirt off and crammed it in my mouth. I could not holler.
